newsitem.title: FRANCE: TNT expects near normal France services.
newsitem.headline: TNT expects near normal France services.

text.p: TNT Express Worldwide said it expected to ensure near-normal services this evening despite changes to its air cargo flight programme brought about by a strike by French air traffic controllers.

"In association with L'Aeropostale, we have been able to negotiate with the French civil aviation on maintaining certain flights from the French provinces to Paris/CDG and also our European hub in Cologne," a TNT official told Reuters.
TNT charters cargo capacity on French airline L'Aeropostale's cargo-configurated Boeing 737QC (quick change) services operating between CDG and Bordeaux, Marseille, Nantes and Toulouse.
"While the Bordeaux and Nantes flights have been cancelled, the Marseille and Toulouse flights will go ahead with only minor modifications to normal timetabling."
Plans had been laid to ship Bordeaux freight on the Toulouse flight while air cargo from Nantes will be trucked to CDG, the official said.
TNT had also made contingency plans for export shipments from Nice which are normally carried to Paris aboard an Air France SA passenger flight.
"Following the cancellation of this flight, Nice shipments will be trucked to Marseille and transported aboard a L'Aeropostale flight to Paris."
TNT's 737QC feeders synchronise with its 727F Paris and Cologne service which will be maintained this evening, the official added.

TNT's BAe146 service between Lyon and Cologne had been cancelled and the express operator will be trucking shipments by road to its European hub early this evening instead. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax +44 1717542 5017
